Q.title: Will Brazil implement a national climate change policy that includes penalties for misinformation about climate change before January 1, 2028?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, in the period from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028, Brazil formally enacts a national policy that includes specific penalties for spreading misinformation regarding climate change, as documented in official legal publications.

P_given_Q.title: Given Brazil implements a national climate change policy with penalties for misinformation, will Brazil legally classify climate change denial as a crime before January 1, 2028?
P_given_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, in the period from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028, Brazil formally enacts a national policy that includes specific penalties for spreading misinformation regarding climate change, and if, in the same period, the Brazilian government formally acknowledges climate change denial as a criminal act. This acknowledgment must be enacted into law and documented in Brazil's official legal publications.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given Brazil does not implement a national climate change policy with penalties for misinformation, will Brazil legally classify climate change denial as a crime before January 1, 2028?
P_given_not_Q.body: Suppose the following is true: Brazil does not implement a national climate change policy that includes penalties for misinformation about climate change before January 1, 2028. This question will resolve as Yes if, in the period from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028, the Brazilian government formally acknowledges climate change denial as a criminal act. This acknowledgment must be enacted into law and documented in Brazil's official legal publications.
